2.title: EURO COINS
clues: Greece's 2-Euro coin shows Europa being abducted by this god in the guise of a bull

Both Monaco's and Belgium's Euros feature royal personages with this name, one a king, one a prince

3.title: INVESTING WITH WARREN BUFFETT
clues: Buffett had the sense to buy $600 million worth of this company the year it introduced the Sensor razor; ka-ching!
Buffett grabbed 5% of the stock in this company a few years before it introduced the gold card
In 1972, the fudge loving Warren Buffett bought See's Candies for $25 million; it's yielded $1 billion in income and helps rocket the stock of this, Buffett's investment company
Buffett calls the purchase of this insurance company one of his best investments; he first bought its stock in 1951
In the '70s Buffett got into news & now has 18% of this company based in our nation's capital

10.title: OF THE FLIES
clues: Musca domestica is the scientific name for this ever-present type of fly
The structure of these is the defining difference between true flies & other insects called flies

11.title: OF THE DANCE
clues: The jarabe tapatio is another name for this Mexican dance; you can do it around a sombrero
Small wild canines are naturals at this American ballroom dance combining slow & fast steps

In a "grand" one of these steps, the legs are 180 degrees apart, with a correspondingly high jump
